newsitem.title: POLAND: Poland sells PLN 295 mln fixed bonds, prices rise.
newsitem.headline: Poland sells PLN 295 mln fixed bonds, prices rise.

text.p: The Polish treasury sold 253 million zlotys worth of 16-percent two-year bonds after investors bid for 477 million of the fixed bonds, it said.
It also sold 42 million zlotys of 12-percent five-year bonds after investors bid for 109 million zlotys.
The treasury offer was a combined 800 million zlotys.
The minimum price of the shorter paper, due on October 12, 1998, rose to 93.84 from 93.62 at the last auction on August 22 and the average price rose to 93.92 from 93.85.
For the longer paper, maturing on October 12, 2001, the minimum price rose to 80.84 from 80.68 on August 22 and the average price to 80.95 from 80.87.
The settlement date for the two-year bonds is October 5, 1996 and October 12, 1996 for the five-year bonds.
The treasury plans to hold its next two- and five-year fixed bond auction on October 17.
